Scott wrote:

>	JUnit's most important contribution (IMHO) are the interfaces in
junit.framework.* -- not the test 
>	runners, which for some reason have become the focus here.  Think of
it like the Servlet API or EJB or 
> 	whatever.  The JCP provides an API, some tech specs, and a reference
implementation which allow 
>	vendors to provide containers that support the API, add extra
features and basically build a cottage
> 	industry around it.

Very well put, and thank you for your clear posting.

Using your analogy, I am looking for a declarative way to express runtime
information to the container. Kinda like the metadata in WEB-INF/ -- where
servlets express what other servlets they depend upon -- it needs to be part
of the specification. I want it managed in/on the entity itself, not on a
separate object, I hate managing things in two places.

I think it needs to be part of the "spec" so all containers can optionally
implement it, I don't want to be forced to write another container. 

Thank you.

regards,

Adam
